intro: Thlaspi oxyceras, commonly known as the sharp-fruited cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its basal rosette of pinnately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in racemes. Its fruit is a short, cylindrical silique that contains several seeds. Thlaspi oxyceras is often found in moist, calcareous soils in temperate regions.
